Lauren Goodger begged fans to delete candid pictures they'd taken of her as she hung out in a bar where pal James 'Arg' Argent was performing.

The former TOWIE star got all dolled up last night as she headed to Palma Nova to support her pal as he took to the stage after a difficult week.

She detailed her journey via London's Heathrow Airport through a number of selfies and video clips, but the 33-year-old wasn't happy about people taking snaps of her in the bar.

In Mirror Online's exclusive pictures, Lauren is seen barely looking away from her phone as she settles in for the night.

Lauren appears to be sitting at a table alone as she waits for Arg to take to the stage.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

A drink sits in front of her as she holds up her device in front of her face.

Lauren was wearing a mustard yellow dress that allowed her to flash some flesh.

Her frock was backless, daringly low cut at the front and had a dramatic thigh split too.

At one point, she was pictured standing in the middle of the packed bar with a drink in one hand and her phone in the other.

Despite her fame in the UK, the reality star wasn't happy about fans taking her picture.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Our source said: "When she noticed me taking a picture she stormed over and demanded that I delete it."

Her Instagram Story painted a very different picture though.

On there, Lauren was surrounded by pals who filmed her as she writhed around in her chair doing a sexy dance.

As Arg sings, Lauren twerks in her seat and pulls her dress to one side, running her hand up and down her leg and almost flashing her bum.

Lauren's Instagram pictures also show her looking very different to how she does in our snaps.

(Image: Instagram)

(Image: Instagram)

The former Celebs Go Dating star posted a close up selfie as she waited for her flight.

"They fall inlove before they know my name," she captioned it.

While many people complimented Lauren on her looks, others asked why she felt the need to edit herself.

One said: "Why all the silly filters? Your pics aren’t real. You don’t need them!"

And another said: "Don’t even recognise you in this"

Once she was ready for her night out, Lauren also posed up for a picture, and she looks quite different to how she does in the snaps taken by someone else.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

She wrote: "Don’t hate the player ... hate the game"

"Looking amazing," Katie Price told her.

And one fan said: "Wow you look amazing so pretty stunning tan so glamorous"

But one joked: "Don’t hate the filter hate the frame"

Lauren has been caught editing her pictures a number of times before.

Just this week, one of her Instagram ads was banned by the Advertising Standards Agency (ASA).

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

Posts from Lauren, Katie Price and Georgia Harrison to promote BoomBod were banned or being irresponsible.

A post on Lauren's Instagram account included an image of her standing by a fireplace in athletic clothes holding BoomBod packaging with the text: "Can't believe these amazing results I've gotten with @boombod's 7 Day Achiever. It works so well to decrease bloating and get rid of those late night cravings. This difference I've noticed from using this stuff is amazing."

She told the ASA that she did not state that she had lost weight because of the product, but that it helped with bloating and hunger, adding that her post did not advise using the product for a long time.

Upholding the complaints, the ASA said the ads breached rules around health claims and promoted a dieting product in an irresponsible manner.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: Daily Mirror)

It added: "We were also concerned that the photo of Lauren Goodger appeared to have been edited to make her waist look artificially thin with the result that the images were not representative of her real body shape.

"We considered that was particularly irresponsible in the context of an ad for an appetite suppressant that presented her as an aspirational figure."

Lauren was watching Arg was singing in a bar in Majorca last night, and he admitted it had been "one hell of a week".

It came just days after paramedics rushed to his house after he failed to answer concerned calls for more than 12 hours.

(Image: Daily Mirror)

(Image: MirrorOnline)

Dressed in a smart blue shirt and chinos, he reassured fans that he was feeling fine after a difficult couple of days.

Arg said: "Ladies and gentlemen, my name is James 'Arg' Argent.

"It's been a hell of a week for me, it's been a tough week but I'm so glad to be here tonight.

"You've really all cheered me up."
